intro: Phyllanthus ussuriensis, commonly known as the Ussuri phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of its native ecosystems.
